[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Municipal Library System (MLS) defines requirements for managing members  cataloging  borrowing  returns  and renewals.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: MLS enables structured library operations  supporting registration  book classification  loan enforcement  overdue tracking  and consultation-only access.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: MLS integrates with member databases  identity verification  and cataloging systems for updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: MLS provides dashboards for managing subscriptions  catalog browsing  and loan tracking.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: MLS supports barcode scanners  computing devices for loan processing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: MLS connects with PostgreSQL for storage  using REST APIs for identity verification  transaction history.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: MLS secures data via OAuth 2.0 authentication  JWT  and HTTPS encryption.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: MLS optimizes storage to handle large-scale document indexing  borrowing transactions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: MLS ensures 24/7 availability with automated backups  scheduled maintenance.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: MLS is configurable for single  multi-branch library operations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: MLS integrates with cloud/on-premise deployments  supporting cataloging services for document updates.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: MLS manages member subscriptions  document classification  book borrowing  overdue tracking  renewals.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: MLS serves librarians  registered members  system administrators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: MLS requires internet connectivity for real-time borrowing extensions  catalog updates  identity verification.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: MLS relies on document classification  member records  external cataloging systems.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with identity databases for member verification.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall connect with cataloging systems for document updates.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow librarians to register and manage members  including subscriptions and cancellations (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall classify documents as books  dictionaries  or comics  for cataloging (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall allow members to borrow up to 3 books  enforcing due dates and renewal requests  blocking overdue members until return (REQ-DB-001  REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall track borrowed books and return dates  preventing unauthorized extensions beyond policy limits (REQ-DB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an interface to manage borrowing  returning  tracking.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process borrowing in 2 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store member details  borrowing records  document classifications.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall ensure unique member  document IDs.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with data protection laws for member privacy.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log all transactions  overdue instances  borrowing history for auditing.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests membership management  document classification  borrowing  renewals.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals  API documentation  compliance policies.
[SEC] 5. References: Library regulations  data protection laws  cataloging standards.
